    ) 
    WITH (
        location_id SMALLINT 1,
        borough VARCHAR(15) 2,
        zone VARCHAR(50) 3,
        service_zone VARCHAR(15) 4
    )
    AS [result]

CREATE EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE nyc_taxi_data
WITH (
    LOCATION = 'https://dlgen2udemycourse.dfs.core.windows.net/'
)


CREATE EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE nyc_taxi_data_raw
WITH (
    LOCATION = 'https://dlgen2udemycourse.blob.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/'
)

SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'taxi_zone.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH (
        location_id SMALLINT 1,
        borough VARCHAR(15) 2,
        zone VARCHAR(50) 3,
        service_zone VARCHAR(15) 4
    )
    AS [result]

--DROP EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE nyc_taxi_data_raw;
SELECT name, location from sys.external_data_sources;

USE nyc_taxi_discovery;
SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'calendar.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) AS cal;

select name, location from sys.external_data_sources;

EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set N'SELECT
    *
    FROM
        OPENROWSET(
            BULK ''calendar.csv'',
            DATA_SOURCE = ''nyc_taxi_data_raw'',
            FORMAT = ''CSV'',
            PARSER_VERSION = ''2.0'',
            HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
            FIELDTERMINATOR = '','',
            ROWTERMINATOR = ''\n''
        ) AS cal;'


SELECT *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'calendar.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    )
    WITH (
        date_key INT,
        date DATE,
        year SMALLINT,
        month TINYINT,
        day TINYINT,
        day_name VARCHAR(10),
        day_of_year SMALLINT,
        week_of_month TINYINT,
        week_of_year TINYINT,
        month_name VARCHAR(10),
        year_month INT,
        year_week INT

    ) AS cal;

USE nyc_taxi_discovery;

SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'vendor_unquoted.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) AS vendor;

SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'vendor_escaped.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        ESCAPECHAR = '\\',
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) AS vendor;

SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'vendor.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDQUOTE = '"', --ESSE É O PADRÃO, VAI TRATAR TUDO DENTRO DAS ASPAS COMO DADO NORMAL.
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) AS vendor;

USE nyc_taxi_discovery;

SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_type.tsv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = '\t',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) AS vendor;

USE nyc_taxi_discovery;
--ESSE É UM JEITO DE LER JSON, MAS NÃO É O MAIS EFICIENTE.
SELECT CAST(JSON_VALUE(jsonDoc, '$.payment_type') AS TINYINT) payment_type,
        CAST(JSON_VALUE(jsonDoc, '$.payment_type_desc') AS VARCHAR(15)) payment_type_desc
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'payment_type.json',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        FIELDTERMINATOR = '0x0b',
        FIELDQUOTE = '0x0b',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '0x0a'
    ) 
    WITH (
        jsonDoc NVARCHAR(MAX)
    )
    AS payment_type;

--Jeito mais eficiente de ler jsons
SELECT payment_type, description
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'payment_type.json',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        FIELDTERMINATOR = '0x0b',
        FIELDQUOTE = '0x0b'
    ) 
    WITH (
        jsonDoc NVARCHAR(MAX)
    ) AS payment_type
    CROSS APPLY OPENJSON(jsonDoc)
    WITH (
        payment_type TINYINT,
        description VARCHAR(15) '$.payment_type_desc' --É assim que se renomeia a coluna em um json
    )



--Como ler jsons com array

SELECT payment_type, payment_value_desc
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'payment_type_array.json',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        FIELDTERMINATOR = '0x0b',
        FIELDQUOTE = '0x0b',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '0x0a'
    )
WITH (
    jsonDoc NVARCHAR(MAX)
) AS payment_type
CROSS APPLY OPENJSON(jsonDoc)
WITH(
    payment_type TINYINT,
    payment_type_desc NVARCHAR(MAX) AS JSON
)
CROSS APPLY OPENJSON(payment_type_desc)
WITH(
    sub_type TINYINT,
    payment_value_desc VARCHAR(20) '$.value'

)

USE nyc_taxi_discovery;

SELECT rate_code_id, rate_code
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'rate_code.json',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        FIELDTERMINATOR = '0x0b',
        FIELDQUOTE = '0x0b',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '0x0b'
    ) 
    WITH (
        jsonDoc NVARCHAR(MAX)
    ) AS rate_code
    CROSS APPLY OPENJSON(jsonDoc)
    WITH (
        rate_code_id TINYINT,
        rate_code VARCHAR(20)
    )
